Package drawit

Class RoundedPolygon

java.lang.Object
drawit.RoundedPolygon
public class RoundedPolygon
extends java.lang.Object
Creates a RoundedPolygon object and creates the commands for drawing the actual polygon

    Initiates this RoundedPolygon

  • Constructor Details

    • RoundedPolygon

      public RoundedPolygon()
      Initiates this RoundedPolygon

  • Method Details

    • getVertices

      public IntPoint[] getVertices()
      Returns a copy of the array of vertices of the RoundedPolygon
      Returns:
      PointArrays.copy(vertices)

    • getRadius

      public int getRadius()
      Returns the radius of the RoundedPolygon
      Returns:
      rad

    • setVertices

      public void setVertices​(IntPoint[] newVertices)
      Sets the vertices of this RoundedPolygon to the given PointArray
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the given vertices don't define a proper polygon 
      !(PointArrays.checkDefinesProperPolygon(newVertices) != null)
      Postconditions:
      the vertices now equal the given PointArray 
      this.getVertices()[0].getX() == PointArrays.copy(newVertices)[0].getX()

    • setRadius

      public void setRadius​(int radius)
      Sets the radius of this RoundedPolygon to the given radius
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the given radius is negative 
      !(radius < 0)
      Postconditions:
      rad now equals the given radius 
      getRadius() == radius

    • insert

      public void insert​(int index, IntPoint point)
      Inserts the given point into this vertex array at the given index
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the index goes out of the bounds of the IntPoint[] object 
      !(index < 0 || index > getVertices().length)
      Postconditions:
      The length of this array is increased by one 
      getVertices().length == old(getVertices()).length+1
      the given IntPoint has been inserted into this PointArray at the given index 
      getVertices()[index] == point

    • remove

      public void remove​(int index)
      removes the point at the given index from this vertex array
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the index goes out of the bounds of the IntPoint[] object 
      !(index < 0 || index >= getVertices().length)
      Postconditions:
      The length of this array is reduced by one 
      getVertices().length == old(getVertices()).length-1
      the IntPoint at the given index has been removed from this PointArray 
      index > getVertices().length-1 || getVertices()[index] != old(getVertices()[index])

    • update

      public void update​(int index, IntPoint point)
      Replaces the point at the given index of this vertex array by another
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the index goes out of the bounds of the IntPoint[] object 
      !(index < 0 || index >= getVertices().length)
      Postconditions:
      The length of this array stays the same 
      getVertices().length == old(getVertices()).length
      the IntPoint at the given index of this PointArray has been replaced by the given IntPoint 
      getVertices()[index] == point

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(IntPoint point)
      Returns whether the given point is contained by this figure
      Postconditions:
      returns true when the IntPoint is contained by this RoundedPolygon otherwise returns false The IntPoint is contained when it lies either on another vertex, an edge or when the amount of intersections between the vector, made by the given point and another at a far distance, and the edges is odd.

    • getDrawingCommands

      public java.lang.String getDrawingCommands()
      Returns a string containing the drawing commands to draw this figure
      Postconditions:
      Returns a string ("line" and possibly "arc") containing the drawing commands to draw this RoundedPolygon. Returns an empty string when there are less than 3 vertices. Returns two "line" strings when the three vertexes are colinear. Otherwise returns two "line" and one "arc" string.
